body_content.explanation: a piece of hair that grows or has been formed into a curving shape, or something that is the same shape as this:
examples: Her hair fell in curls over her shoulders.
Curls of smoke were rising from the chimney.

body_content.explanation: the curved shape in which a ball moves when it is hit or kicked in a particular way:
examples: The curl on the shot sent it looping around the keeper into the far corner of the net.

body_content.explanation: an exercise using weights in which you move your arm or leg from straight to bent and back:
examples: She uses 5-pound weights for bicep curls.
Twice a week, do both leg extensions and leg curls on a weight machine.

body_content.explanation: to make something into the shape of a curl, or to grow or change into this shape:
examples: Does your hair curl naturally, or is it permed?
A new baby will automatically curl its fingers round any object it touches.

body_content.explanation: to make a ball move in a curved shape by hitting or kicking it in a particular way or of a ball, to move in this way:
examples: He curled the ball into the top right hand corner.

body_content.explanation: to show by an upward movement of one side of your mouth that you feel no respect for something or someone:
examples: Her lip curled at what he said.

body_content.explanation: to play the sport of curling (= a game played on ice in which stones are slid towards a mark):
examples: "Learn to curl" sessions teach you the basics of curling.
